abstracts.cdata!:
As a result of the project, higher
            electricity tariffs and improved metering and collection
            will encourage electricity conservation.  Orissa's
            existing thermal generation will be renovated and new
            capacity will be constructed and operated by private
            utilities in accordance with modern practices and applicable
            national environmental standards.  Three transmission line
            projects have been reviewed and will be included in the
            first phase of the loan.  The environmental issues related
            to these transmission and distribution projects in general
            and to the three selected project individually are discussed
            in this study.  Issues that have been addressed during the
            conceptual design of the project are: 1) resettlement and
            rehabilitation; 2) transmission line rights of way and
            substation site impacts on land use (agriculture, forest
            areas, wetlands, wildlands); 3) access roads in remote
            areas, increase in hunting, exploitation of forest
            resources, induced development due to new access corridors,
            human settlement and more extensive clearing; 4) clearing
            (erosion, loss of habitat) and control of vegetation in
            rights of ways, including mechanical and chemical clearing
            operations; 5) erosion during construction, and along access
            roads, substation and transmission tower sites; 6) potential
            electromagnetic frequency radiation effects, radio noise and
            television interference; and &) public access to
            substations, towers and electrocution hazards, proximity to airports.
